index-paragraph-1: This tool lets you edit the rank of multiple statements at once.
index-batch-paragraph-1: Several batch modes are also available. You can provide the statements as a list or select them with a SPARQL query, and you can perform the same action (set or increment rank) for all statements or specify a rank for each individual statement. Please select below which batch mode you want to use.
edit-must-log-in: You must [$1 log in] to make edits.
edit-paragraph-1-logged-in: You can edit the rank of the following $3 {{PLURAL:$1|statement|statements}} on $2:
edit-paragraph-1-logged-out: Once you log in, you can edit the rank of the following $3 {{PLURAL:$1|statement|statements}} on $2:
edit-noscript: Enable JavaScript for “select all”, “select none” and “invert selection” buttons. (The rest of the tool works without JavaScript, if you can’t enable it.)
batch-list-individual-input: Statement IDs, ranks, and optional reasons for the rank (one per line, separated by tab or pipe characters):
batch-query-collective-input-wdqs: [$1 Wikidata Query Service] query, selecting a ?statement variable:
batch-query-individual-input-wdqs: [$1 Wikidata Query Service] query, selecting ?statement and ?rank variables (and optionally ?reason, ?reasonForPreferredRank and ?reasonForDeprecatedRank as well, with the latter two taking precedence over the former):
error-no-such-entity: No entity with the ID $1 exists on $2.
